Class GameManager

java.lang.Object
org.mio.progettoingsoft.GameManager
public class GameManager extends Object
Manages all ongoing game instances and the creation of new games. This class is implemented as a Singleton to ensure only one instance manages all game states and client connections on the server. It tracks connected clients, handles player registration to games, and orchestrates the lifecycle of game instances.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameManager()
    Private constructor to enforce the Singleton pattern.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameManager

      public GameManager()
      Private constructor to enforce the Singleton pattern. Initializes the map for ongoing games.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static GameManager getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of GameManager. This method is thread-safe and ensures that only one instance of GameManager exists.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of the class.

    • getWaitingGame

      public GameServer getWaitingGame()
      Retrieves the current game that is in a waiting state for players or settings. If no game is currently waiting, a new Game instance is created.
      Returns:
      The GameServer instance that is currently waiting.

    • getOngoingGames

      public Map<Integer,GameServer> getOngoingGames()
      Returns a Map representing all games that are currently in progress.
      Returns:
      A Map<Integer, GameServer> where keys are game IDs and values are GameServer instances.

    • addClientToAccept

      public int addClientToAccept(VirtualClient client)
      Adds a new VirtualClient to the list of clients awaiting game assignment. Assigns a unique ID to the client.
      Parameters:
      client - The VirtualClient to be added.
      Returns:
      The unique integer ID assigned to the client.

    • emptyWaitingGame

      public void emptyWaitingGame()
      Resets the waitingGame to null, indicating that no game is currently accepting new players or configurations. This is typically called after a game has started or been cancelled.

    • addNickname

      public void addNickname(String nick)
      Adds a new nickname to the list of active nicknames. This is used to track occupied nicknames across all games.
      Parameters:
      nick - The nickname String to add.

    • addPlayerToGame

      public void addPlayerToGame(int idClient, String nickname)
      Attempts to add a connected client (identified by idClient) to a game using the provided nickname. Handles nickname uniqueness, game creation, and player assignment to the waiting game.
      Parameters:
      idClient - The unique ID of the client connecting.
      nickname - The desired nickname for the player.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there's an issue with client communication or game state.

    • getCreatingGame

      public AtomicBoolean getCreatingGame()
      Returns the AtomicBoolean flag indicating if a game is currently being created/configured. This is useful for external synchronization.
      Returns:
      The AtomicBoolean flag for creatingGame.

    • getLockCreatingGame

      public Object getLockCreatingGame()
      Returns the lock object used for synchronizing game creation. This allows other components to wait on this lock.
      Returns:
      The Object used as a lock.

    • removeOnGoingGame

      public void removeOnGoingGame(int idGame)
      Removes an ongoing game from the ongoingGames map. This is typically called when a game concludes or crashes.
      Parameters:
      idGame - The ID of the game to remove.
